snippet: With the peace process stalled, analysts see nonviolent resistance as a critical tactic for the Palestinian national movement.
abstract: More than 1,500 Palestinians in Israeli jails join a hunger strike to demand improved prison conditions; with the peace process stalled, many analysts see this nonviolent resistance as a critical tactic for the Palestinian national movement, and a potential catalyst to bring an Arab Spring-style uprising to the West Bank.

byline.contributor: Khaled Abu Aker contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank, and Rina Castelnuovo from Ramle, Israel.

lead_paragraph: With the peace process stalled, analysts see nonviolent resistance as a critical tactic for the Palestinian national movement.

headline.seo: Palestinian Resistance Shifts to Hunger Strikes
headline.main: Palestinians Go Hungry to Make Their Voices Heard
headline.print_headline: Palestinians Go Hungry To Make Their Voices Heard
